title.@value: Myeloid neoplasm associated with PDGFRB rearrangement

definition.@value: A distinct type of myeloid neoplasm that occurs in association with rearrangement of PDGFRB gene at 5q32. Patients usually present with a picture resembling chronic myelomonocytic leukaemia and, less often atypical chronic myeloid leukaemia or chronic eosinophilic leukaemia.

label.@value: Myeloid neoplasm associated with PDGFRB rearrangement
Chronic myelomonocytic leukaemia with eosinophilia associated with t(5;12)
Myeloid neoplasms associated with PDGFRB rearrangement
